KnowledgeBase.Title: ccompareNE
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: ccompare ccompareEQ ccompareGT ccompareGE ccompareLT ccompareLE

Function.Description: The ccompareNE is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Character values. It returns true if both objects are not equal and false if otherwise.

Brief.Overview: The ccompareNE is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Character values. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: Use the ccompareNE function when you wish to compare two Characters and determine if {char1} is not equal to {char2} and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). These functions only operate on Character operands. For a more general, but slower, comparison, use the compareEQ, compareNE, compareGT, compareGE, compareLT, and compareLE which performs type checking and type conversions.

Argument.Name: char1
Argument.Note: The first Character to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the both Characters are not equal and false is both Characters are not equal.
